results.title: Discipline: Giving orders
results.brief_description: A Navy training film promoting the idea that staff discipline is the function of a co-operative management style. Includes some illuminating footage of model clerical workplaces and an involuntary endorsment of Coca-Cola.

results.title: Dinner at school
results.creator_credit: H.M. Nieter and Seven League Productions
results.brief_description: Stresses the desirability, during World War II, of a hot midday meal for school children, and shows what was done in Great Britain to make such a meal available, free of charge or at a very low cost.

results.title: Die Deutschen luftwaffe. No. 6. Bombers & bomber ops 1942-1945
results.creator_credit: Mickey Shephard, Mike Croker and VAF Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary video contains some rare archival footage of the German Luftwaffe carrying out some of their bombing operations during the years 1942-1945 of World War II including photo-intelligence surveillance, aerial bombings, strikes on allied convoys with anti-ship missiles and night bomber raids against the British. At one stage during 1942, the Luftwaffe were capable of launching up to 1000 sorties per day. However by 1944 due to the growing effectiveness of Allied air power, the Luftwaffe bombing force began to decline, until Germany’s eventual surrender in May 1945. Aeroplane enthusiasts, and particularly those into war planes, will enjoy this documentary for its informative and historical visuals and its coverage of the various bombers used by the Luftwaffe, including the Junkers Ju-88 and Ju-188, the Dornier 217 series and the Heinkel He-111 and He-177, as well as flying boats and float planes operating from the Mediterranean through to the Arctic Ocean (in rare colour footage). Narrated by Brian Matthews.

results.creator_credit: Jan Bussell, Parthian Production and Peak Films
results.brief_description: Muffin with his thinking cap. Muffin as sleuth wearing black hat and moustache. A dog comes in and complains that he has lost a bone. Song about the “Old Dry Bone”. results.title: Diagnosis of speech and reading problems
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates various tests that the teacher can use to evaluate a student’s neurological development. These include visual pursuit, cortical dominance, cross-pattern creeping, and similar procedures. Slow-motion scenes and freeze frames enhance the value of this training film. (Teacher education)

results.title: Devotion
results.creator_credit: Mindy Kaplan, Arlene Battishill, Dancing Arrow Productions and Northern Arts
results.brief_description: Lesbian and stand-up comic Sheila Caston is about to get her big break - her own TV show. But when it turns out her (unrequited) first love is a central player in the deal, Shelia is thrown into a struggle between past and present; between her unresolved love for TV producer Lynn, and for her partner of five years, Julie. In this emotional maelstrom, personal and professional lives slip into confusion and chaos, throwing Shelia’s career into jeopardy. A love triangle with a 90s twist this film runs the gamut of laughter and tears, joy and sorrow, hope and desperation.

results.title: Deskside manner
results.creator_credit: Hugh Munro, Organisation and Methods Training Council and S.B. Modules
results.brief_description: An abbrassive efficiency expert interviews a worker about his job. A humorous look at office efficiency, emphasising the need to follow logical steps and avoid duplicating work.

results.title: Dental caries in South Africa
results.creator_credit: South Africa. Dept. of Education. Film Services Union
results.brief_description: The film depicts the incidence of the disease in various parts of South Africa, and deals with the following aspects: effects of fluoride; mottling and hypoplasia, contributory causes of decay; preventive measures; correct methods of brushing the teeth; correct diet; regular dental examination.

results.title: Defence of Peace
results.creator_credit: Marcel De Hubsch and ATLANTIC FILM
results.brief_description: ‘Defence of peace’ was commissioned by the United Nations Department of Public Information being made shortly after the organisations formation in 1945. The film is about the creation of the United Nations and provides historical context to the organisation’s formation. ‘Defence of Peace’ contrasts the organisation with it’s non-political predecessor “The League of Nations”. It explains why the league failed and how the UN as an organisation was designed to be politically effective. Also discussed is the structure and fundamental operations of the UN.
